RuleInstance.Name: Serialization -> Type -> Implement "GetObjectData" method correctly
RuleInstance.Title: Implement ISerializable correctly
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem:
The type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface and contains GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method which is not externally visible.

- OR -

Non sealed type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface and contains GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method which is not overridable.

- OR -

The type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface, but does not override the GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method and the type declares instance fields that are not marked with the System.NonSerializedAttribute attribute.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
If a type is derived from one that implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface and it has instance fields that need to be serialized, the derived class must implement both the serialization constructor as well as the GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method. Fields that are not to be serialized should be marked with the NonSerializedAttribute attribute, which explicitly excludes the target field from the serialization process.

Implementations of the GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method should be externally visible, if the type is not sealed. That enable derived types to call and override the method.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Implement ISerializable correctly', CheckId CA2240
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options depending from detected violation:
  • Find method GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) and change its modifier.
  • Add method GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) and add instance fields to the serialization process.
  • Add empty method GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext).
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Implement ISerializable correctly.

RuleInstance.Name: Custom Serialization -> Class -> Implement ISerializable if class expose events
RuleInstance.Title: Implement ISerializable for serializable classes that expose events
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem: Type which exposes events has System.SerializableAttribute attribute.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription: For each event, both the Visual Basic .NET and the C# compiler define a hidden delegate field; delegate types aren't serializable and any attempt to serialize an instance that contains non-null delegates will fail. By implementing custom serialization, you can skip these delegate fields in the serialization process.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options:
  • Implement interface System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable for the type
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Implement System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable for serializable classes that expose events.

RuleInstance.Name: Custom Serialization -> Type -> Implement serialization constructor
RuleInstance.Title: Implement serialization constructor
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem:
The type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface, but does not have a constructor with the System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature.

- OR -

The unsealed type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface and have a serialization constructor (with the System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature) with non protected access modifier.

- OR -

The sealed type {0} implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface and have a serialization constructor (with the System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature) with non private modifier.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Implement serialization constructors', CheckId CA2229
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription: You can add the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface to a type to customize the serialization process. Both GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) and the special serialization constructor must be implemented in that case. The serialization constructor is required when the object is deserialized. A System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException will be thrown when an attempt is made to deserialize a type without the constructor.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options depending from detected violation:
  • Add constructor with System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature and add instance fields to the serialization process.
  • Add empty constructor with System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature.
  • Find constructor with System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature and change its modifier.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Implement serialization constructor.

RuleInstance.Name: Serialization -> Method -> Implement serialization methods correctly
RuleInstance.Title: Implement serialization methods correctly
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem:
The type has System.SerializableAttribute attribute and has a method (with System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature) that handles a serialization event with incorrect visibility modifier.

- OR -

The type has System.SerializableAttribute attribute and has a method that handles a serialization event with incorrect parameter list.

- OR -

The type has System.SerializableAttribute attribute and has a method that handles a serialization event with incorrect parameter return type.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
According to Microsoft .NET Framework guidelines, method that handles a serialization event should take a single parameter of type System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext, return void, and have private visibility modifier.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Implement serialization methods correctly', CheckId CA2238
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options depending from detected violation:
  • Find method with System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext parameter signature and change its visibility modifier to private.
  • Find method and change its parameter signature to System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext.
  • Find method and change return type to void.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Implement serialization methods correctly.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleExample:
The following example shows shows correctly declared serialization event handlers.

[Visual Basic]


' This is the correct implementation

Imports System.Runtime.Serialization

<SerializableAttribute> _ 
Public Class SampleTypeWithEventHandlers

  <OnSerializingAttribute> _ 
  Private Sub OnSerializing(context As StreamingContext) 
  
    ...
  
  End Sub

  <OnSerializedAttribute> _ 
  Private Sub OnSerialized(context As StreamingContext) 
  
    ...
  
  End Sub

  <OnDeserializingAttribute> _ 
  Private Sub OnDeserializing(context As StreamingContext)
  
    ...
  
  End Sub

  <OnDeserializedAttribute> _ 
  Private Sub OnDeserialized(context As StreamingContext)
  
    ...
  
  End Sub

End Class

[C#]


// This is the correct implementation

using System.Runtime.Serialization;

[SerializableAttribute]
public class SampleTypeWithEventHandlers
{

  [OnSerializingAttribute]
  private void OnSerializing(StreamingContext context) 
  {
  
    ...
  
  }

  [OnSerializedAttribute]
  private void OnSerialized(StreamingContext context) 
  {
  
    ...
  
  }

  [OnDeserializingAttribute]
  private void OnDeserializing(StreamingContext context)
  {
  
    ...
  
  }

  [OnDeserializedAttribute]
  private void OnDeserialized(StreamingContext context)
  {
  
    ...
  
  }

}

RuleInstance.Name: Custom Serialization -> Field -> Include instance fields in the serialization/deserialization process
RuleInstance.Title: Include instance fields in the serialization/deserialization process.
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem:
The type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface, contains instance field that is not marked with the System.NonSerializedAttribute attribute.

- OR -

The field is not included in the serialization process in GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
If a type implements the System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface, than all of its instance fields should be included in the serialization/deserialization process of expicitly marked with System.NonSerializedAttribute attribute.

To include the instance field in the serialization/deserialization process, the type must implement the GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) method and special serialization constructor.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Implement ISerializable correctly', CheckId CA2240
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options depending from detected violation:
  • Find method GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext) and insert AddValue() call at the end of the method.
  • Add System.NonSerializedAttribute to the instance field.
  • Find serialization constructor and insert GetValue() call at the end of the constructor.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Include instance fields in the serialization/deserialization process.

RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default

RuleInstance.Name: Custom Serialization -> Type -> Mark ISerializable Types With Serializable Attribute
RuleInstance.Title: Mark ISerializable types with "Serializable" attribute
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem: The type implements certain interface, but is not marked with specific attribute.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
If the type implements some certain interface, then it should be marked with specific attribute.

Types implementing System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface must be marked with SerializedAttribute attribute. A type that implements System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface but isn't marked with the SerializableAttribute attributemight not be serialized under all circumstances and might not be recognized as serializable by reflection code that only checks for the presence of the attribute.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Mark ISerializable types with serializable', CheckId CA2237
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options:
  • Mark the type with specific attribute.

  • MustImplement - Type should implement the specified type or interface.

RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
Often, the case statements in a switch are the only logical options, so a default statement should be added to catch any options that are outside the accepted range of inputs.

- OR -

Handle gracefully situations where some additional values are defined in an enum and the switch has case statements for only the earlier values of the enum.

RuleInstance.Name: Serialization -> Field -> Provide deserialization methods for optional fields
RuleInstance.Title: Provide deserialization methods for optional fields
RuleInstance.Scope: Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Unsafe, SpecialName, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Default
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem: Type marked with System.SerializableAttribute attribute, and has a field with System.Runtime.Serialization.OptionalFieldAttribute attribute but does not provide de-serialization event handling methods (with OnDeserializingAttribute and OnDeserializedAttribute attributes).
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
System.Runtime.Serialization.OptionalFieldAttribute specifies that a field can be missing from a serialization stream. This attribute allows to specify that new fields in a serializable type are ignored by the System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter or the System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Soap.SoapFormatter. Field marked with System.Runtime.Serialization.OptionalFieldAttribute attribute is serialized, but it is ignored on de-serialization and retains the default value. De-serialization event handlers should be created to initialize the field with the value, which depends from other deserialized values.

This rule is similar to FxCop rule 'Provide deserialization methods for optional fields', CheckId CA2239
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options depending from detected violation:
  • Add two deserialization event handling methods by applying System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializedAttribute and System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute attributes.
  • Add deserialization event handling method by applying System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializedAttribute attribute.
  • Add deserialization event handling method by applying System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute attribute.
  • Initialize field in the deserialization event handling method marked with System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializedAttribute attribute.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • Provide deserialization methods for optional fields.

RuleInstance.Name: Xaml File -> 'ControlTemplate' object should define 'TargetType' member
RuleInstance.Title: ControlTemplate object should define TargetType member
RuleInstance.Scope: New, Public, Protected, Internal, ProtectedInternal, Private, Abstract, Sealed, Static, Readonly, Virtual, Override, Extern, Unsafe, Literal, Const, Volatile, WriteOnly, WithEvents, Any
RuleInstance.HelpRuleProblem: Xaml file contains object and its member is empty.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleDescription:
Xaml object should always define specified member.

This rule is similar to the following FxCop rules:
  • 'Sequence activity should have child activities', CheckId XWF1000
  • 'Delay duration has not been set', CheckId XWF1003
  • 'Parallel activity should have atleast one branch', CheckId XWF1004
RuleInstance.HelpRuleCorrectingViolations:
The rule provides the following auto-correct options:
  • Specifiy value for member manually.
  • Remove empty member from object manually.
RuleInstance.HelpRuleInstances:
Instances of this rule in the built-in profile:
  • ControlTemplate object should define TargetType member.
  • Delay object should define Duration member.
  • Parallel object should define Branches member.
  • Sequence object should define Activities member.
